name: execute-read-command
description:
Execute a read-only CLI command (get, search, list, export). Use discover-commands first to find the right command.

Key concepts:
- Entities (Company, Person, Opportunity): Global CRM records. Use 'company ls', 'person ls' to search ALL entities.
- Lists: Collections with custom fields. Use 'list export <id>' to get entries from a specific list.
- To filter by list-specific fields (Status, Stage, etc.), use 'list export', NOT 'company ls'.

Examples:
- company ls --limit 10
- company ls --filter 'name =~ "Acme"'
- list ls (find list IDs)
- list export 12345 --filter 'Status="Active"' (filter by field value)
- list export 12345 --saved-view "Pipeline View" (use pre-configured view, NOT a field value)
- person get 67890

Filter syntax: 'field op "value"' where op is = != =~ (contains) =^ (starts) =$ (ends) > < >= <=

command.description: CLI command path (e.g., 'person get', 'company ls', 'list export'). Use discover-commands to find available commands.

argv.description: Command arguments as array. Include IDs as first element, then flags. Example: ['12345', '--filter', 'Status=Active', '--limit', '50']

maxOutputBytes.description: Maximum output size in bytes (default 50000). Larger outputs are truncated with truncated=true marker. Use --limit flag to reduce output size.

dryRun.description: If true, return the command that would be executed without running it. Useful for verification.
